message: no freeking way does draper 'realize' who he is. the one thing 'draper' is about is using what is at hand to improve his own station in life -- and no one else's particularly. that happened in korea, it happened when he first met sterling, and it happened at various times during his career and in his personal life. the ending is no different. advertising to that point had been all about communicating to american society that was on the move outward -- in cars and planes while selling stuff and consuming, at any cost. sitting there with the meditators, draper now understands that american culture in 1971 or whenever was turning inward, as it would on many levels for the next 20 years at least. his epiphany, as it was for his entire industry at that time, was to change direction, too. hence, that endlessly aggravating coke commercial, which is all about making ourselves feel good about ourselves. which, of course, is consistent with the ultimate draper-ism: 'happiness is what we feel the moment before we crave more happiness.'

Why are so many here comparing themselves to children? A delayed school opening and calling in late to your job are two completely different things. A child is not going to be destined to a lazy life cause of a delayed opening. Calling a kid weak and lazy is pretty low if you ask me. I dont thing you look tough trying to one up a child. Grow up and worry about your own life. And we dont need to keep hearing about how you walked up hill both ways in a blizzard every day when you were in school.
